description: Gwyneth Paltrow's USA-based website Goop has come to the rescue of victims of workplace sexism with a guide to fighting back on behalf of the sisterhood.
title: Gwyneth Paltrow’s Goop pens a guide to fighting sexism
title_page: Gwyneth Paltrow’s Goop pens a guide to fighting sexism | Daily Mail Online
text:
If you have ever had a manterrupter butt into your conversation, or perhaps a bropriator steal your work without proper credit, you'll be pleased to hear that help is now at hand.
Gwyneth Paltrow's website Goop has come to the rescue of victims of these cardinal workplace sins with a guide to fighting back on behalf of the sisterhood - just so long as you are not a womenemy (that's someone who undermines other women).
The bizarre terms were decoded in a Q&A session on workplace sexism featuring Jessica Bennett, an American journalist and author of Feminist Fight Club.
Scroll down for video
Gwyneth Paltrow's blog Goop has come to the rescue of victims of manterrupters, bropriators and womenemies with a guide to fighting back on behalf of the sisterhood
Ms Bennett prescribes a series of remedies in countering these examples of 'subtle sexism in the workplace' in an article entitled 'Are You Subtly Sexist? (Most Likely, Yes)'.
On dealing with a manterrupter, she says one solution is to carry on talking until the other person is silenced into submission.
Alternatively, you could lean into the table, as this makes you seem more assertive, meaning others will be less likely to interrupt you mid-conversation, Bennett says.
Otherwise, you could explain to the manterrupter that he is butting in and insist he stops doing so.
The terms were decoded in piece on workplace sexism featuring author Jessica Bennett (left, at a launch in 2016). Right: Gwyneth Paltrow pictured in London on June 22, 2016
DO KEEP UP! THE LATEST BUZZWORDS Manterrupter - Regularly interrupts when you speak. Bropriators - Takes the credit for somebody else's work. Womenemy - Views other women as competition and undermines them.
Battling bropriators merits two responses, notes Ms Bennett.
... AND THE OLD CLASSICS Mansplaining - Explaining something to someone, typically a woman, in a patronising or condescending manner. Manspreading - Sitting with your legs wide open so you take up more than one seat, usually on public transport.
One technique is to publicly thank the person for using your concept - thus reminding everyone that it is yours.
Ms Bennett also recommends discussing with other female colleagues about the importance of standing up for each other's ideas.
But none of this is of any use when dealing with a womenemy.
However, you should resist the temptation to act aggressively and instead remind the womenemy of your joint interests in fighting the patriarchy.
Goop is well known for offering a stream of unorthodox health, wellbeing and relationship tips alongside bizarre products since it was founded by mother-of-two Gwyneth in 2008.
In February, it urged women to burn their bras, saying they could be carrying the 'negative energy and memories' of your failed relationships.
Goop is well known for offering a stream of unorthodox tips, including burning your bras after a relationship
The ritual was detailed on the site by relationship expert Suzannah Galland, who explained it was most effective when performed during a full moon.
Other pearls of wisdom from Goop include the introduction of stone 'sex eggs' said to improve women's orgasms to its online store, and a guide to vaginal steaming.
Goop has also recommended kitchen 'essentials' like the Kamado-San Donabe Rice Cooker - just $210 (£172).
And the website's 'easy work-morning routine' has 10 steps - starting with applying $110 (£90) organic facial oil.
